headline: Eby calls for ‘new era’ of cooperation with feds in letter to Carney | Globalnews.ca

annotations.reason: This is a reading time estimate, which is not relevant to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph:
1:55
																									B.C. Premier Eby writes letter to Prime Minister Carney
annotations.reason: This is a video timestamp and title, not contributing new information to the article.

annotations.paragraph: British Columbia’s premier has written to the country’s freshly re-elected prime minister, laying out the province’s priorities.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces the main action of the article, which is relevant.

annotations.paragraph: In a letter dated Thursday, David Eby congratulated Mark Carney on his election win and urged him to “commit to a new era of federal-provincial-territorial cooperation.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the letter's content and its significance.

annotations.paragraph: The missive comes following a campaign in which Carney positioned himself as best prepared to bolster Canada’s economy and sovereignty under the shadow of U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff and annexation threats.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Carney's campaign, which is relevant to understanding the political backdrop of the letter.
